DataElement.preferredName: Laboratory Procedure During Patient Visit Reticulocyte Count Performed Indicator
DataElement.preferredDefinition: The response indicating whether or not a reticulocyte count was performed during the patient visit.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Laboratory Procedure During Patient Visit Reticulocyte Count Performed
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: Any procedure that involves testing or manipulating a sample of blood, urine, or other body substance in a laboratory setting._At some point in a given period of time._A visit by a patient or study participant to a medical professional._Immature erythrocytes that have just undergone extrusion of their cell nucleus. They still contain some organelles that gradually decrease in number as the cells mature._To determine the number or amount of something; the result of this activity._Executed and carried through to completion.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A procedure for critical evaluation; a means of determining the presence, quality, or truth of something.

Concepts.definition: Any procedure that involves testing or manipulating a sample of blood, urine, or other body substance in a laboratory setting.

Property.preferredName: During Patient Visit Reticulocyte Count Performed
Property.preferredDefinition: At some point in a given period of time.:A visit by a patient or study participant to a medical professional.:Immature erythrocytes that have just undergone extrusion of their cell nucleus. They still contain some organelles that gradually decrease in number as the cells mature.:To determine the number or amount of something; the result of this activity.:Executed and carried through to completion.

Concepts.definition: At some point in a given period of time.
A visit by a patient or study participant to a medical professional.
Immature erythrocytes that have just undergone extrusion of their cell nucleus. They still contain some organelles that gradually decrease in number as the cells mature.
Determining the number or amount of something.
Executed and carried through to completion.
